alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Clark; Jackson; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 27 at 9:33PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Minnesota and Wisconsin, including the following counties, in southeast Minnesota, Wabasha. In Wisconsin, Buffalo, Clark, Jackson, Taylor and Trempealeau. * WHEN...Until 5 AM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms in a west to east line will continue to develop across parts of eastern Minnesota into west central Wisconsin overnight. Additional storms are expected to develop overnight and move over the same areas due to a slow moving boundary. Rainfall of 3 to 5 inches could fall resulting in localized flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
